Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a man whose job is to sell goods 推销员，售货员
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  an insurance salesman

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  spend a long time doing sth.; stay for a long time, esp. because one does not want to leave 磨蹭；留恋徘徊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There will be no time to linger -- the press conference will begin in a few minutes.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a person who forecasts the weather, esp. on TV or radio 气象（报告）员
n. a doctor who performs medical operations 外科医生
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a heart surgeon

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a mark left on the skin by a wound, burn, etc. after it has healed 伤疤 vt.   leave a scar on  给……留下伤痕
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's easy to recognize the little boy because he has a scar on his left arm.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   place where a battle is or was fought 战场
n.   the quality of being worthy of honor or respect 尊严
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A physician shall be dedicated to providing competent medical service with compassion and respect for human dignity.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  cause to become unable to move or walk properly 使跛，使受伤致残 n. 	a lame person 跛子，伤残人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  At the beginning of the year 2000 crippled children were on state lists to receive care.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   show a lack of loyalty to; give or show (sb./sth.) to an enemy 背叛，出卖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was accused of betraying his country during the war.

Vocabularies.Definition: come closer to, esp. a rival or sth. pursued 逼近
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Hurry up -- they are gaining on us!

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.    shake from cold, fear, weakness, etc. 颤抖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her hands grew very cold and trembled so that she could hardly hold the flag.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    casual trousers 宽松裤
a., n.   yellowish brown (color) 棕褐色（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a tan leather jacket

Vocabularies.Definition: n.     an entrance, esp. a passage or small entrance hall 入口 entry   n.    进入；入口
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A narrow entryway led directly through the house into the garden behind.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.      公文包
(cause to) rise 踢起；扬起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The horses kicked up a cloud of dust.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   (cause to) move into a sloping position （使）倾斜 n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The pilot can tilt the helicopter forward, backward, or to either side.

Vocabularies.Definition: (leant or leaned)  v.   (cause to) be in a sloping position; bend （使）倾斜；屈身    a.  producing little of value; containing little or no fat 收益少的；瘦的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She leaned over the bridge to look at the boats passing beneath it.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    a small book containing pictures and information about sth. or advertising sth. （宣传）小册子
a.  fastened to sth. with a clip 用夹子夹牢的，用别针别住的 clip   n. 夹子，别针
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a clip-on tie

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the process of birth; the delivering of letters, goods, etc. 分娩；投递
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Women who do manual work have easy deliveries.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    any of the parts into which sth. is divided 部分
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Newspapers typically have sections for local news, sports, arts and entertainment, business, and classified advertising.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    of the brain （大）脑的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His father died unexpected of a cerebral hemorrhage（脑溢血）.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   an illness causing one to be unable to move 麻痹，瘫痪
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  cerebral palsy  大脑性麻痹

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    disturbance of the normal working of the body or mind;  lack of order （机能）失调；混乱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Severe vitamin and mineral deficiencies can lead to mental disorders.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   move from one place to another 调动，转移 n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Transferring Peter from Tokyo to the Boston office was a smart idea.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. lack of ability 缺陷；局限 e.g.  Electric cars could travel only a short distance before they needed recharging, due to the limitations of battery technology.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Electric cars could travel only a short distance before they needed recharging, due to the limitations of battery technology. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: make a formal request for 申请 e.g.  According to the school regulations students will have to apply for permission to study abroad.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  According to the school regulations students will have to apply for permission to study abroad. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: abbr.   company 公司
n.   代表 e.g.  Egypt, Israel, and the representatives of the Palestinian people will participate in negotiations on the resolution of the Palestinian problem.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Egypt, Israel, and the representatives of the Palestinian people will participate in negotiations on the resolution of the Palestinian problem. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    printed material used to advertise or promote a product; writings that are valued as works of art 宣传资料；文献；文学作品 e.g.  My friend is sending me literature from two other companies that provide a similar service.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My friend is sending me literature from two other companies that provide a similar service. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a solemn promise 保证，许诺 vt. e.g.  The boy made a pledge to get straight A's at the end of the semester.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The boy made a pledge to get straight A's at the end of the semester. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the practice of selling goods in small quantities to the general public 零售 v. e.g.  Wal-Mart is a company that operates a variety of retail chain stores.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Wal-Mart is a company that operates a variety of retail chain stores. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   passage through or across; a system of urban public transportation 通行，过境；公共交通运输系统
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Our fleet made the transit through the Panama Canal without any difficulty.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a large covered area containing many different shops 购物中心
vt.    injure (part of) the body or make it weak by too much effort 损伤；使劳损 n.  	a severe demand on mental or physical strength, resources, abilities, etc. 重负,压力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Swimming does not strain joints and connective tissue as much as many other forms of exercise.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  关节
a. not fulfilling the intended purpose 无用的，无效的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Preventing the country from purchasing oil crippled its army and made its navy and air force completely useless.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a leg or an arm; a large branch of a tree 肢；腿；臂；树枝
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  No attempt should be made to move broken limbs until medical help arrives.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    腰
in an unsteady position or about to fall 不平衡 e.g.  The motorcycle knocked him off balance and he fell down on the ground.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The motorcycle knocked him off balance and he fell down on the ground. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    a child who has only recently learnt to walk 学步的儿童
n.   an act of polishing sb.'s shoes 擦皮鞋
n.   （鞋）带；花边
n.   活动范围；领土
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The government denies that any of its territory is under rebel control.

Vocabularies.Definition: be talking to sb. using the phone 在打电话 e.g.  Please wait outside for a moment; the manager is on the phone.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Please wait outside for a moment; the manager is on the phone. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   （烹饪）调料
v.  be recognized or noted mentally; record a name, an event, etc. for official purposes 被注意到；登记
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  On occasions what I said didn't register in my daughter's brain.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  clothes or sheets, etc. that have been or need to be washed 洗好（或待洗）的衣服 e.g.  The new model washing machine offers numerous settings for washing different types and quantities of laundry.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The new model washing machine offers numerous settings for washing different types and quantities of laundry. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   bringing profit or advantage 有利可图的；有益的 e.g.  The trading department of the investment bank buys and sells securities when profitable opportunities arise.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The trading department of the investment bank buys and sells securities when profitable opportunities arise. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: no longer standing 躺着；坐着
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The doctor checked his left foot carefully and said he would have to stay off his feet for about two weeks.

Vocabularies.Definition: abbr.    video cassette recorder （盒式磁带）录像机
(pl. antennas or antennae) n.  aerial 天线
a.  done or existing alone; without companion 单独的，独自的；孤独的 e.g.  There was a solitary sheep in the field.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There was a solitary sheep in the field. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    烤箱，炉
n.   money paid to sb. for selling goods which increases with the quantity of goods sold 佣金，回扣
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  If a salesperson is paid on commission, the amount they receive depends on the amount they sell.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  外科手术
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  People have practiced surgery since ancient times, but it did not become a respected science until the 19th century.

Vocabularies.Definition: be laid  up (with) stay in bed, be unable to work, etc. （因……）卧床休养；无法工作 e.g.  Our math teacher has been laid up in bed with acute flu for a week.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Our math teacher has been laid up in bed with acute flu for a week. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  (AmE)  a book of printed cheques 支票簿
n.    a person who receives sth. 接受人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The recipients of prizes had their names printed in the paper.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a person's name written by herself or himself 签名
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In law, signatures are put at the end of a legal instrument to show that it is valid.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   write or draw in a rough, careless or hurried way 潦草地写
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He scrawled a hasty note to his wife.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   difficult or impossible to read; too dull or too difficult to be worth reading 难以辨认的；枯燥无味的，无法读的
v.  hit with a whip, rope, etc. 鞭打；猛烈打击
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The man lashed the donkey but it would not go any faster.

Vocabularies.Definition: punctually, not too late; eventually 及时；最终
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The couple have just arrived in time for lunch.

Vocabularies.Definition: (of electric power, a light, etc.)  stop functioning or operating 停止；熄灭
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  All the lights suddenly went off and the stadium was plunged into darkness.
